searchBox.examples_label: For example <1>"instrument calibration"</1> or <4>neutron AND scattering</4>.
searchBox.limited_results_message: Only the top {{maxNumResults}} results will be displayed for each type

loading.filter_message: No results found with current filters applied, please modify filter settings and try again.

advanced_search_help.title: Advanced Search Tips
advanced_search_help.description: When you search for a word e.g. 'calibration', we will search for any records containing this word. But, sometimes you may wish to be more specific. Here we show you how.

exact_phrase.title: Search by an exact phrase
exact_phrase.description: Use quotation marks around a phrase to search for a precise sequence of words e.g. <2>"neutron scattering"<2>.

logic_operators.title: Using logic operators
logic_operators.description:
Find all data containing 'neutron' and 'scattering' with <1>'neutron AND scattering'.

Find all data containing either neutron or scattering with '<4>neutron OR scattering'.

Find all data that contains the phrase 'scattering' but exclude those containing 'elastic' with '<7>scattering NOT elastic'.

Use brackets around phrases to construct more complicated searches e.g. '<10>scattering NOT (elastic OR neutron)'.

wildcards.title: Using wildcards
wildcards.description:
Use wildcards to take the place of one or more characters in a phrase.

A question mark '?' can be used to search for a phrase with one or more character missing e.g. '<2>te?t' will return results containing 'test' or 'text'.

An asterix '*' can be used to replace zero or more characters e.g. '<4>*ium' will return results containing words like 'sodium' and 'vanadium'.

limited_search_results.title: Limited results
limited_search_results.description: Due to technical and performance reasons, only the top {{maxNumResults}} results will be displayed for each entity type i.e. Investigation, Dataset or Datafile. If you find your search gives {{maxNumResults}} results, try using a more specific query to find what you are looking for.

advanced_search_help.footer: Further information on searching can be found <2>here</2>.
